page.title: 08FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: Within the area, there was evidence of farmers cultivating their fields for {intensive grazing.}During the summer period in which the survey was carried out,{hay and silage}were being cut. On the higher ground where the fields were more exposed to the weather, the land was used for{rough grazing}of bullocks and sheep.Here, stone walls formed the boundaries, while in the valleys, there were natural hedges. There was no corn.The larger farms at Gothers and Coldvreath had herds of cows.The majority of farms were {small-holdings}with only a small but varied number of animals that included goats, poultry-hens,geese,guinea-fowl and turkeys for Christmas and pigs. Farm machinery included tractors, mowers,balers,manure-distributors, rollers,discs,fertiliserspreaders and chain-harvesters.
